definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: In the army brigade drama, the "movie eighteen years" has a typical representative.
sentences.chinese: 在军旅题材电视剧中，《敌营十八年》具有典型性。

sentences.english: He don't break his promise and sends back the prince to enemy's camp next day.
sentences.chinese: 胡将军没有食言，次日便将太子送回敌营。

sentences.english: Our troops raided the enemy camp.
sentences.chinese: 我们的部队袭击了敌营。

sentences.english: Two time thorough hostile camp's results are single-handedly are encircled.
sentences.chinese: 两次单枪匹马深入敌营的结果都是被围剿。

sentences.english: Our troops struck the enemy camp at night.
sentences.chinese: 我们的部队夜间袭击了敌营。

sentences.english: The soldiers descended upon the enemy camp and destroy it.
sentences.chinese: 战士突然袭击并歼灭了敌营。

sentences.english: 9-10. Alfred stayed in the camp a week before he returned to Athelney.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔弗雷德在敌营呆了一周后回到了阿塞尔纳。

sentences.english: Alfred stayed in the camp a week before he returned to Athelney.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔弗雷德在敌营呆了一个星期后，回到了阿塞尔纳。

sentences.english: Orders were received that we should make a night march and beat up the enemy's quarters.
sentences.chinese: 我们接到命令，要我们乘夜进军偷袭敌营。

sentences.english: General Hu sticked to his promise and sent the prince back the next day.
sentences.chinese: 胡将军没有食言，次日便将太子送回敌营。

sentences.english: They attacked the camp by surprise.
Our troops struck the enemy camp at dawn.
sentences.chinese: 我们的部队在黎明时分袭击了敌营。

sentences.english: He was captured by the enemy, but escaped from prison shortly thereafter.
sentences.chinese: 他被敌人俘虏，但很快就从敌营中逃脱。

sentences.english: We beat up the enemy's quarters last night.
Closer and closer, your Knight took my Pawn.
Our army pounded at the enemy's camp and destroyed it.
sentences.chinese: 我军用炮向敌营连续猛轰并摧毁了它。

definition: to seize a camp/to surprise the enemy in bed
